rows.translation: They said: We desire that we should eat of it and that our hearts should be at rest, and that we may know that you have indeed spoken the truth to us and that we may be of the witnesses to it.
rows.transliteration: qālū nurīdu an na-kula minhā wataṭma-inna qulūbunā wana`lama an qad ṣadaqtanā wanakūna `alayhā minash shāhidīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ ٱللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَآ أَنزِلْ عَلَيْنَا مَآئِدَةً مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ تَكُونُ لَنَا عِيدًا لِّأَوَّلِنَا وَءَاخِرِنَا وَءَايَةً مِّنكَ ۖ وَٱرْزُقْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
rows.translation: Isa the son of Marium said: O Allah, our Lord! send down to us food from heaven which should be to us an ever-recurring happiness, to the first of us and to the last of us, and a sign from Thee, and grant us means of subsistence, and Thou art the best of the Providers.
rows.transliteration: qāla `īsab-nu maryamallāhumma rabbanā anzil `alaynā mā-idatan minas samā-i takūnu lanā `īdal li-awwalinā wa-ākhirinā wa-āyatan mink ۖ warzuqnā wa-anta khayrur rāziqīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱللَّهُ إِنِّى مُنَزِّلُهَا عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَمَن يَكْفُرْ بَعْدُ مِنكُمْ فَإِنِّىٓ أُعَذِّبُهُۥ عَذَابًا لَّآ أُعَذِّبُهُۥٓ أَحَدًا مِّنَ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Allah said: Surely I will send it down to you, but whoever shall disbelieve afterwards from among you, surely I will chastise him with a chastisement with which I will not chastise, anyone among the nations.
rows.transliteration: qālallāhu innī munazziluhā `alaykum ۖ faman yakfur ba`du minkum fa-innī u`adhhibuhu `adhābal lā u`adhhibuhu aḥadan minal `ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ يَـٰعِيسَى ٱبْنَ مَرْيَمَ ءَأَنتَ قُلْتَ لِلنَّاسِ ٱتَّخِذُونِى وَأُمِّىَ إِلَـٰهَيْنِ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ قَالَ سُبْحَـٰنَكَ مَا يَكُونُ لِىٓ أَنْ أَقُولَ مَا لَيْسَ لِى بِحَقٍّ ۚ إِن كُنتُ قُلْتُهُۥ فَقَدْ عَلِمْتَهُۥ ۚ تَعْلَمُ مَا فِى نَفْسِى وَلَآ أَعْلَمُ مَا فِى نَفْسِكَ ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ عَلَّـٰمُ ٱلْغُيُوبِ
rows.translation: And when Allah will say: O Isa son of Marium! did you say to men, Take me and my mother for two gods besides Allah he will say: Glory be to Thee, it did not befit me that I should say what I had no right to (say); if I had said it, Thou wouldst indeed have known it; Thou knowest what is in my mind, and I do not know what is in Thy mind, surely Thou art the great Knower of the unseen things.
rows.transliteration: wa idh qālallāhu yā`īsab-na maryama a-anta qulta linnāsit-takhidhūnī wa-ummiya ilāhayni min dūnillāh ۖ qāla subḥānaka mā yakūnu lī an aqūla mā laysa lī biḥaqq ۚ in kuntu qultuhu faqad `alimtah ۚ ta`lamu mā fī nafsī walā a`lamu mā fī nafsik ۚ innaka anta `allāmul ghuyūb

rows.arabic: مَا قُلْتُ لَهُمْ إِلَّا مَآ أَمَرْتَنِى بِهِۦٓ أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ رَبِّى وَرَبَّكُمْ ۚ وَكُنتُ عَلَيْهِمْ شَهِيدًا مَّا دُمْتُ فِيهِمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا تَوَفَّيْتَنِى كُنتَ أَنتَ ٱلرَّقِيبَ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَأَنتَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
rows.translation: I did not say to them aught save what Thou didst enjoin me with: That serve Allah, my Lord and your Lord, and I was a witness of them so long as I was among them, but when Thou didst cause me to die, Thou wert the watcher over them, and Thou art witness of all things.
rows.transliteration: mā qultu lahum illā mā amartanī bihi ani'-budullāha rabbī warabbakum ۚ wakuntu `alayhim shahīdan mā dumtu fīhim ۖ falammā tawaffaytanī kunta antar raqība `alayhim ۚ wa-anta `alā kulli shay-in shahīd

rows.arabic: إِن تُعَذِّبْهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ عِبَادُكَ ۖ وَإِن تَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ فَإِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: If Thou shouldst chastise them, then surely they are Thy servants; and if Thou shouldst forgive them, then surely Thou art the Mighty, the Wise.
rows.transliteration: in tu`adhhibhum fa-innahum `ibāduk ۖ wa in taghfir lahum fa-innaka antal `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱللَّهُ هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ يَنفَعُ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ صِدْقُهُمْ ۚ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا ۚ رَّضِىَ ٱللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا۟ عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
rows.translation: Allah will say: This is the day when their truth shall benefit the truthful ones; they shall have gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide in them for ever: Allah is well pleased with them and they are well pleased with Allah; this is the mighty achievement.
rows.transliteration: qālallāhu hādhā yawmu yanfa`uṣ ṣādiqīna ṣidquhum ۚ lahum jannātun tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru khālidīna fīhā abadā ۚ raḍiyallāhu `anhum waraḍū `anh ۚ dhālikal fawzul `aẓīm

rows.arabic: لِلَّهِ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا فِيهِنَّ ۚ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌۢ
rows.translation: Allah's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is in them; and He has power over all things.
rows.transliteration: lillāhi mulkus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā fīhinn ۚ wahuwa `alā kulli shay-in qadīr
